label: Enable YAML Header Parsing
helpText:
If enabled, the plug-in tries to extract the attributes TITLE, AUTHOR and DATE from a YAML header and prepend these infos to the rendered output. The YAML header will be removed from the rendered output. This functionality can be useful, when a YAML header is needed for external processing like in the project Markdown Reporter.

A YAML header (also known as a front matter block) is a block of configuration options wrapped in three minus signs. It is commonly used in static site generators these days - see the example from Jekyll.
